title: Cedar Breaks National Monument: Multimedia Presentations
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Multimedia Presentations              Multimedia Presentations                         Yellow-bellied Marmot Yellow-bellied marmots are members of the rodent family and are frequently sighted along the rim of Cedar Breaks' amphitheater.  Duration:20 seconds                                Red Fox Red foxes are one of few predators that inhabit the high plateau.  Duration:33 seconds                                California Condors California Condors sometimes pass through Cedar Breaks in late summer. These endangered birds have only survived through a rigorous captive breeding program.  Duration:12 seconds                                Mule Deer and Fall colors This video was filmed September 2012. Mule deer are often seen in morning and late evening during the summer season.   Duration:16 seconds                 Sunset View Josh Boles, NPS  These Quicktime VR panoramic images allow viewers to scan right and left and in some cases all the way around. They provide a way of getting an overall impression of a scene and not just one static view. Click on the links and when the panorama opens in a new window, hold down the mouse on the image and drag to the right or left to pan around. Use the + and - buttons to zoom in and out. Please note that you will need the latest version of Apple's QuickTime software to view the QTVR Movies below. If you do not have the latest version click here to download it for free. Point Supreme QTVR 360 Point Supreme With Snow QTVR 360 North View QTVR 180 Brian Head Peak From North View Parking Lot QTVR 360 North End Of Alpine Pond QTVR 180 South End Of Alpine Pond QTVR 360 Chessman Ridge Overlook QTVR 200 Sunset View QTVR 180   Panoramic photos and QTVR's by Josh Boles
